Technical lemma to control the addition of functions in `L^p` even for `p < 1`: Given `δ > 0`,
there exists `η` such that two functions bounded by `η` in `L^p` have a sum bounded by `δ`. One
could take `η = δ / 2` for `p ≥ 1`, but the point of the lemma is that it works also for `p < 1`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α) [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  (p : ENNReal) {δ : ENNReal},
  δ ≠ 0 →
    ∃ η,
      0 < η ∧
        ∀ (f g : α → E),
          MeasureTheory.AEStronglyMeasurable f μ →
            MeasureTheory.AEStronglyMeasurable g μ →
              MeasureTheory.snorm f p μ ≤ η → MeasureTheory.snorm g p μ ≤ η → MeasureTheory.snorm (f + g) p μ < δ
name: MeasureTheory.exists_Lp_half
docString:
Technical lemma to control the addition of functions in `L^p` even for `p < 1`: Given `δ > 0`,
there exists `η` such that two functions bounded by `η` in `L^p` have a sum bounded by `δ`. One
could take `η = δ / 2` for `p ≥ 1`, but the point of the lemma is that it works also for `p < 1`.

For all natural numbers x, ↑x < ⊤ in the real numbers.

name: PartENat.natCast_lt_top
docString: For all natural numbers x, ↑x < ⊤ in the real numbers.

This theorem, `one_le_div'`, states that for any type `α` that has a group structure and a less-than-or-equal-to (`≤`) relation, and where the multiplication operation is covariant, for any two elements `a` and `b` of type `α`, `1` is less than or equal to the division of `a` by `b` if and only if `b` is less than or equal to `a`. In other words, if you can meaningfully divide and compare elements in `α`, this theorem relates the ordering of `a` and `b` to the ordering of `1` and `a / b`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : LE α]
  [inst_2 : CovariantClass α α (Function.swap fun x x_1 => x * x_1) fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1] {a b : α}, 1 ≤ a / b ↔ b ≤ a
name: one_le_div'
docString: This theorem, `one_le_div'`, states that for any type `α` that has a group structure and a less-than-or-equal-to (`≤`) relation, and where the multiplication operation is covariant, for any two elements `a` and `b` of type `α`, `1` is less than or equal to the division of `a` by `b` if and only if `b` is less than or equal to `a`. In other words, if you can meaningfully divide and compare elements in `α`, this theorem relates the ordering of `a` and `b` to the ordering of `1` and `a / b`.

For any `y < 1` and any positive `x`, there exists `n : ℕ` with `y ^ n < x`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedSemifield α] [inst_1 : Archimedean α] [inst_2 : ExistsAddOfLE α] {x y : α},
  0 < x → y < 1 → ∃ n, y ^ n < x
name: exists_pow_lt_of_lt_one
docString: For any `y < 1` and any positive `x`, there exists `n : ℕ` with `y ^ n < x`.

For all integers x and k (with k != 0), k * ⌊x / k⌋ ≤ x.

name: Int.mul_ediv_self_le
docString: For all integers x and k (with k != 0), k * ⌊x / k⌋ ≤ x.

This theorem, named `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Module.Defs._auxLemma.19`, asserts that for any type `ι`, a function `α : ι → Type v` mapping `ι` to `Preorder`, and two instances `x` and `y` from `ι` to `α i`, `x` is less than `y` if and only if `x` is less than or equal to `y` and there exists an `i` such that `x i` is less than `y i`. Basically, it defines the "less than" relation in terms of "less than or equal to" relation and an existential quantification.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u} {α : ι → Type v} [inst : (i : ι) → Preorder (α i)] {x y : (i : ι) → α i},
  (x < y) = (x ≤ y ∧ ∃ i, x i < y i)
name: Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Module.Defs._auxLemma.19
docString: This theorem, named `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Module.Defs._auxLemma.19`, asserts that for any type `ι`, a function `α : ι → Type v` mapping `ι` to `Preorder`, and two instances `x` and `y` from `ι` to `α i`, `x` is less than `y` if and only if `x` is less than or equal to `y` and there exists an `i` such that `x i` is less than `y i`. Basically, it defines the "less than" relation in terms of "less than or equal to" relation and an existential quantification.

If `x` is a Liouville number, then for any `n`, for infinitely many denominators `b` there
exists a numerator `a` such that `x ≠ a / b` and `|x - a / b| < 1 / b ^ n`.

type: ∀ {x : ℝ}, Liouville x → ∀ (n : ℕ), ∃ᶠ (b : ℕ) in Filter.atTop, ∃ a, x ≠ ↑a / ↑b ∧ |x - ↑a / ↑b| < 1 / ↑b ^ n
name: Liouville.frequently_exists_num
docString:
If `x` is a Liouville number, then for any `n`, for infinitely many denominators `b` there
exists a numerator `a` such that `x ≠ a / b` and `|x - a / b| < 1 / b ^ n`.

For any two elements `x`, `y` such that `0 < y`, there exists a natural number `n`
such that `x ≤ n • y`.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : OrderedAddCommMonoid α] [self : Archimedean α] (x : α) {y : α}, 0 < y → ∃ n, x ≤ n • y
name: Archimedean.arch
docString:
For any two elements `x`, `y` such that `0 < y`, there exists a natural number `n`
such that `x ≤ n • y`.

If `ξ` is an integer, all its convergents equal `ξ`.

type: ∀ {ξ : ℤ} (n : ℕ), Real.convergent (↑ξ) n = ↑ξ
name: Real.convergent_of_int
docString: If `ξ` is an integer, all its convergents equal `ξ`.

The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f) (nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0))
    (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_thickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

Equality is decidable if `≤` is.

type: {α : Type u} → [inst : PartialOrder α] → [inst : DecidableRel fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1] → DecidableEq α
name: decidableEqOfDecidableLE
docString: Equality is decidable if `≤` is.

Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] (f : α → β) (E : Set α) (x : α),
  ∀ᶠ (δ : ℝ) in nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0),
    Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f x = Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f x
name: mulIndicator_thickening_eventually_eq_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

`⊥` is the least element

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : LE α] [self : OrderBot α] (a : α), ⊥ ≤ a
name: OrderBot.bot_le
docString: `⊥` is the least element

Let `{x | p x}` be a subsemigroup of a commutative monoid `M`. Let `f : M → N` be a map
such that `f 1 = 1` and `f` is submultiplicative on `{x | p x}`, i.e.,
`p x → p y → f (x * y) ≤ f x * f y`. Let `g i`, `i ∈ s`, be a finite family of elements of `M` such
that `∀ i ∈ s, p (g i)`. Then `f (∏ i in s, g i) ≤ ∏ i in s, f (g i)`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {M : Type u_4} {N : Type u_5} [inst : CommMonoid M] [inst_1 : OrderedCommMonoid N] (f : M → N)
  (p : M → Prop),
  f 1 = 1 →
    (∀ (x y : M), p x → p y → f (x * y) ≤ f x * f y) →
      (∀ (x y : M), p x → p y → p (x * y)) →
        ∀ (g : ι → M) {s : Finset ι},
          (∀ i ∈ s, p (g i)) → f (Finset.prod s fun i => g i) ≤ Finset.prod s fun i => f (g i)
name: Finset.le_prod_of_submultiplicative_on_pred
docString:
Let `{x | p x}` be a subsemigroup of a commutative monoid `M`. Let `f : M → N` be a map
such that `f 1 = 1` and `f` is submultiplicative on `{x | p x}`, i.e.,
`p x → p y → f (x * y) ≤ f x * f y`. Let `g i`, `i ∈ s`, be a finite family of elements of `M` such
that `∀ i ∈ s, p (g i)`. Then `f (∏ i in s, g i) ≤ ∏ i in s, f (g i)`.

The infimum of `x` and `xᶜ` is at most `⊥`

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [self : BooleanAlgebra α] (x : α), x ⊓ xᶜ ≤ ⊥
name: BooleanAlgebra.inf_compl_le_bot
docString: The infimum of `x` and `xᶜ` is at most `⊥`

Let `u₁`, `u₂` be two uniform structures on `γ` and `𝔖₁ 𝔖₂ : Set (Set α)`. If `u₁ ≤ u₂` and
`𝔖₂ ⊆ 𝔖₁` then `𝒱(α, γ, 𝔖₁, u₁) ≤ 𝒱(α, γ, 𝔖₂, u₂)`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {γ : Type u_3} ⦃u₁ u₂ : UniformSpace γ⦄,
  u₁ ≤ u₂ → ∀ ⦃𝔖₁ 𝔖₂ : Set (Set α)⦄, 𝔖₂ ⊆ 𝔖₁ → UniformOnFun.uniformSpace α γ 𝔖₁ ≤ UniformOnFun.uniformSpace α γ 𝔖₂
name: UniformOnFun.mono
docString:
Let `u₁`, `u₂` be two uniform structures on `γ` and `𝔖₁ 𝔖₂ : Set (Set α)`. If `u₁ ≤ u₂` and
`𝔖₂ ⊆ 𝔖₁` then `𝒱(α, γ, 𝔖₁, u₁) ≤ 𝒱(α, γ, 𝔖₂, u₂)`.

Let `{x | p x}` be a subsemigroup of a commutative monoid `M`. Let `f : M → N` be a map
submultiplicative on `{x | p x}`, i.e., `p x → p y → f (x * y) ≤ f x * f y`. Let `g i`, `i ∈ s`, be
a nonempty finite family of elements of `M` such that `∀ i ∈ s, p (g i)`. Then
`f (∏ x in s, g x) ≤ ∏ x in s, f (g x)`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {M : Type u_4} {N : Type u_5} [inst : CommMonoid M] [inst_1 : OrderedCommMonoid N] (f : M → N)
  (p : M → Prop),
  (∀ (x y : M), p x → p y → f (x * y) ≤ f x * f y) →
    (∀ (x y : M), p x → p y → p (x * y)) →
      ∀ (g : ι → M) (s : Finset ι),
        s.Nonempty → (∀ i ∈ s, p (g i)) → f (Finset.prod s fun i => g i) ≤ Finset.prod s fun i => f (g i)
name: Finset.le_prod_nonempty_of_submultiplicative_on_pred
docString:
Let `{x | p x}` be a subsemigroup of a commutative monoid `M`. Let `f : M → N` be a map
submultiplicative on `{x | p x}`, i.e., `p x → p y → f (x * y) ≤ f x * f y`. Let `g i`, `i ∈ s`, be
a nonempty finite family of elements of `M` such that `∀ i ∈ s, p (g i)`. Then
`f (∏ x in s, g x) ≤ ∏ x in s, f (g x)`.

For `a ≤ b`, `a` left divides `b`

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Mul α] [inst_1 : LE α] [self : ExistsMulOfLE α] {a b : α}, a ≤ b → ∃ c, b = a * c
name: ExistsMulOfLE.exists_mul_of_le
docString: For `a ≤ b`, `a` left divides `b`

If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `δ`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‖f' x - A‖ ≤ δ`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : FiniteDimensional ℝ E] {s : Set E}
  {f : E → E} [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace E] [inst_4 : BorelSpace E] (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure E)
  [inst_5 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure μ] {A : E →L[ℝ] E} {δ : NNReal},
  ApproximatesLinearOn f A s δ →
    MeasurableSet s →
      ∀ (f' : E → E →L[ℝ] E),
        (∀ x ∈ s, HasFDerivWithinAt f (f' x) s x) → ∀ᵐ (x : E) ∂MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict μ s, ‖f' x - A‖₊ ≤ δ
name: ApproximatesLinearOn.norm_fderiv_sub_le
docString:
If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `δ`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‖f' x - A‖ ≤ δ`.

Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : ι → Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `δ : C(X, ℝ)` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {X : Type u_2} [inst : MetricSpace X] {K U : ι → Set X},
  (∀ (i : ι), IsClosed (K i)) →
    (∀ (i : ι), IsOpen (U i)) →
      (∀ (i : ι), K i ⊆ U i) →
        LocallyFinite K → ∃ δ, (∀ (x : X), 0 < δ x) ∧ ∀ (i : ι), ∀ x ∈ K i, Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i
name: Metric.exists_continuous_real_forall_closedBall_subset
docString:
Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : ι → Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `δ : C(X, ℝ)` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : ι → Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `δ : C(X, ℝ≥0)` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {X : Type u_2} [inst : MetricSpace X] {K U : ι → Set X},
  (∀ (i : ι), IsClosed (K i)) →
    (∀ (i : ι), IsOpen (U i)) →
      (∀ (i : ι), K i ⊆ U i) →
        LocallyFinite K → ∃ δ, (∀ (x : X), 0 < δ x) ∧ ∀ (i : ι), ∀ x ∈ K i, Metric.closedBall x ↑(δ x) ⊆ U i
name: Metric.exists_continuous_nNReal_forall_closedBall_subset
docString:
Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : ι → Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : ι → Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `δ : C(X, ℝ≥0)` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

Let `M` be a smooth σ-compact manifold with a metric. Let `K : ι → Set M` be a locally finite
family of closed sets, let `U : ι → Set M` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all
`i`. Then there exists a positive smooth function `δ : M → ℝ≥0` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`,
we have `Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type uι} {E : Type uE} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : FiniteDimensional ℝ E]
  {H : Type uH} [inst_3 : TopologicalSpace H] (I : ModelWithCorners ℝ E H) {M : Type u_1} [inst_4 : MetricSpace M]
  [inst_5 : ChartedSpace H M] [inst_6 : SmoothManifoldWithCorners I M] [inst_7 : SigmaCompactSpace M] {K U : ι → Set M},
  (∀ (i : ι), IsClosed (K i)) →
    (∀ (i : ι), IsOpen (U i)) →
      (∀ (i : ι), K i ⊆ U i) →
        LocallyFinite K → ∃ δ, (∀ (x : M), 0 < δ x) ∧ ∀ (i : ι), ∀ x ∈ K i, Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i
name: Metric.exists_smooth_forall_closedBall_subset
docString:
Let `M` be a smooth σ-compact manifold with a metric. Let `K : ι → Set M` be a locally finite
family of closed sets, let `U : ι → Set M` be a family of open sets such that `K i ⊆ U i` for all
`i`. Then there exists a positive smooth function `δ : M → ℝ≥0` such that for any `i` and `x ∈ K i`,
we have `Metric.closedBall x (δ x) ⊆ U i`.

The multiplicative indicators of closed δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the
multiplicative indicator of the set, as δ tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.cthickening δ E) f) (nhds 0) (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_cthickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of closed δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the
multiplicative indicator of the set, as δ tends to zero.

If `d₁ < d₂`, then for any set `s` we have either `μH[d₂] s = 0`, or `μH[d₁] s = ∞`.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_2} [inst : EMetricSpace X] [inst_1 : MeasurableSpace X] [inst_2 : BorelSpace X] {d₁ d₂ : ℝ},
  d₁ < d₂ →
    ∀ (s : Set X),
      ↑↑(MeasureTheory.Measure.hausdorffMeasure d₂) s = 0 ∨ ↑↑(MeasureTheory.Measure.hausdorffMeasure d₁) s = ⊤
name: MeasureTheory.Measure.hausdorffMeasure_zero_or_top
docString: If `d₁ < d₂`, then for any set `s` we have either `μH[d₂] s = 0`, or `μH[d₁] s = ∞`.
